subject: p10183775
History: An-year-old with end-stage renal disease with nocturnal hypoxia, rule out acute pulmonary process. Comparison is made to prior study of. Portable AP chest film of at hours is submitted.
Impression: Status post median sternotomy for CABG with stable cardiac enlargement and calcification of the aorta consistent with atherosclerosis. Relatively lower lung volumes with no focal airspace consolidation appreciated. Crowding of the pulmonary vasculature with possible minimal perihilar edema, but no overt pulmonary edema. No pleural effusions or pneumothoraces.
